Heading: CD standard audio format
Note: CD ‘red book’ format

Heading: MP3 format
Note: MPEG-1/2 Audio Layer III file

Heading: WMA
Note: Windows Media Audio format

Heading: AAC
Note: Advanced Audio Coding format

Heading: Ogg/Vorbis
Note: Vorbis audio format in the Ogg container

Heading: Audible
Note: Audio format proprietary to Audible.com

Heading: FLAC
Note: Free lossless audio codec

Heading: AIFF
Note: Audio Interchangeable File Format

Heading: ALAC
Note: Apple Lossless Audio Codec

Heading: DAISY 2: full audio with title only (no navigation)
Note: Deprecated, as does not meet DAISY 2 standard. Use conventional audiobook codes instead

Heading: DAISY 2: full audio with navigation (no text)
DAISY 2: full audio with navigation and partial text
DAISY 2: full audio with navigation and full text
DAISY 2: full text with navigation and partial audio
Note: Reading systems may provide full audio via text-to-speech

Heading: DAISY 2: full text with navigation and no audio
Note: Reading systems may provide full audio via text-to-speech

Heading: DAISY 3: full audio with title only (no navigation)
Note: Deprecated, as does not meet DAISY 3 standard. Use conventional audiobook codes instead

Heading: DAISY 3: full audio with navigation (no text)
DAISY 3: full audio with navigation and partial text
DAISY 3: full audio with navigation and full text
DAISY 3: full text with navigation and partial audio
Note: Reading systems may provide full audio via text-to-speech

Heading: DAISY 3: full text with navigation and no audio
Note: Reading systems may provide full audio via text-to-speech

Heading: Readalong audio
Note: Audio intended exclusively for use alongside a printed copy of the book. Most often a children’s product. Normally contains instructions such as ‘turn the page now’ and other references to the printed item, and is usually sold packaged together with a printed copy

Heading: Playalong audio
Note: Audio intended for musical accompaniment, eg ‘Music minus one’, etc, often used for music learning. Includes singalong backing audio for musical learning or for Karaoke-style entertainment

Heading: Speakalong audio
Note: Audio intended for language learning, which includes speech plus gaps intended to be filled by the listener

Heading: Synchronised audio
Note: Audio synchronised to text within an e-publication, for example an EPUB3 with audio overlay. Synchronisation at least at paragraph level, and covering the full content

Heading: Sound effects
Note: Incidental sounds added to the audiobook narration (eg background environmental sounds)

Heading: Background music
Note: Incidental music added to the audiobook narration (eg to heighten atmosphere). Do not use where the music is a primary part of the audio

Heading: Mono
Note: Includes ‘stereo’ where channels are identical

Heading: Stereo 2.1
Note: Stereo plus low-frequency channel

Heading: Surround 4.1
Note: Five-channel audio (including low-frequency channel)

Heading: Surround 5.1
Note: Six-channel audio (including low-frequency channel)

Heading: Mass market (rack) paperback
Note: In North America, a category of paperback characterized partly by page size (typically from 6¾ up to 7⅛ x 4¼ inches) and partly by target market and terms of trade. Use with Product Form code BC

Heading: Trade paperback (US)
Note: In North America, a category of paperback characterized partly by page size (larger than rack-sized) and partly by target market and terms of trade. AKA ‘quality paperback’, and including textbooks. Most paperback books sold in North America except ‘mass-market’ (B101) and ‘tall rack’ (B107) are correctly described with this code. Use with Product Form code BC

Heading: Digest format paperback
Note: In North America, a category of paperback characterized by page size (typically 7 x 5 inches) and generally used for children’s books; use with Product Form code BC. Note: was wrongly shown as B102 (duplicate entry) in Issue 3

Heading: A-format paperback
Note: In UK, a category of paperback characterized by page size (normally 178 x 111 mm approx); use with Product Form code BC

Heading: B-format paperback
Note: In UK, a category of paperback characterized by page size (normally 198 x 129 mm approx); use with Product Form code BC

Heading: Trade paperback (UK)
Note: In UK, a category of paperback characterized largely by size (usually in traditional hardback dimensions), and often used for paperback originals or retailer/travel/export-exclusives; use with Product Form code BC

Heading: Tall rack paperback (US)
Note: In North America, a category of paperback characterised partly by page size (typically 7½ x 4¼ inches) and partly by target market and terms of trade; use with Product Form code BC

Heading: A5 size Tankobon
Note: Japanese A-series size, 210 x 148mm. A tankobon is a complete collected story originally published in serialised form (eg in a magazine)

Heading: JIS B5 size Tankobon
Note: Japanese B-series size, 257 x 182mm

Heading: JIS B6 size Tankobon
Note: Japanese B-series size, 182 x 128mm

Heading: A6 size Bunko
Note: Japanese A-series size, 148 x 105mm

Heading: B40-dori Shinsho
Note: Japanese format, 182x103mm or 173x105mm

Heading: Pocket (Sweden, Norway, France)
Note: A Swedish, Norwegian, French paperback format, of no particular fixed size. Use with Product Form Code BC

Heading: Storpocket (Sweden)
Note: A Swedish paperback format, use with Product Form Code BC. In Finnish, Jättipokkari

Heading: Kartonnage (Sweden)
Note: A Swedish hardback format, use with Product Form Code BB

Heading: Flexband (Sweden)
Note: A Swedish softback format, use with Product Form Code BC

Heading: Mook / Bookazine
Note: A softback book in the format of a magazine, usually sold like a book. Use with Product Form code BC

Heading: Dwarsligger
Note: Also called ‘Flipback’. A softback book in a specially compact proprietary format with pages printed in landscape on very thin paper and bound along the long (top) edge (ie parallel with the lines of text). Use with Product Form code BC – see www.dwarsligger.com

Heading: 46 size
Note: Japanese format, 188 x 127mm

Heading: 46-Henkei size
Note: Japanese format, 188 x 127mm

Heading: A4-Henkei size
Note: Japanese format, 297 x 210mm

Heading: A5-Henkei size
Note: Japanese format, 210 x 146mm

Heading: B5-Henkei size
Note: Japanese format, 257 x 182mm

Heading: B6-Henkei size
Note: Japanese format, 182 x 128mm

Heading: JIS B7 size
Note: Japanese B-series size, 128 x 91mm

Heading: Kiku size
Note: Japanese format, 218 x 152mm or 227 x 152mm

Heading: Kiku-Henkei size
Note: Japanese format

Heading: JIS B4 size
Note: Japanese B-series size, 364 x 257 mm

Heading: Paperback (DE)
Note: German large paperback format, greater than about 205mm high, with flaps. Use with Product form code BC

Heading: Libro de bolsillo
Note: Spanish pocket paperback. Use with Product form code BC

Heading: Pocket-sized
Note: German ,Taschenbuch‘, Italian «Tascabile / Supertascabile» pocket-sized format, usually less than about 205mm high. Use with Product form code BB or BC

Heading: Miniature book
Note: Note: was wrongly shown as B203 (duplicate entry) in Issue 3

Heading: Touch-and-feel book
Note: A book whose pages have a variety of textured inserts designed to stimulate tactile exploration: see also B214 and B215

Heading: Die-cut book
Note: A book which is cut into a distinctive non-rectilinear shape and/or in which holes or shapes have been cut internally. (‘Die-cut’ is used here as a convenient shorthand, and does not imply strict limitation to a particular production process)

Heading: Book-as-toy
Note: A book which is also a toy, or which incorporates a toy as an integral part. (Do not, however, use B213 for a multiple-item product which includes a book and a toy as separate items)

Heading: Soft-to-touch book
Note: A book whose cover has a soft textured finish, typically over board

Heading: Fuzzy-felt book
Note: A book with detachable felt pieces and textured pages on which they can be arranged

Heading: Press-out puzzle pieces
Note: A book containing pages with die-cut or press-out pieces that can be used as a jigsaw, puzzle pieces, etc

Heading: Picture book
Note: Children’s picture book: use with applicable Product Form code

Heading: ‘Carousel’ book
Note: (aka ‘Star’ book). Tax treatment of products may differ from that of products with similar codes such as Book as toy or Pop-up book)

Heading: Pull-the-tab book
Note: A book with movable card ‘tabs’ within the pages. Pull a tab to reveal or animate part of a picture (distinct from a ‘lift-the-flap’ book, where flaps simply reveal hidden pictures, and not a ‘pop-up’ book with 3D paper engineering)

Heading: Loose leaf – sheets and binder
Note: Use with Product Form code BD

Heading: Loose leaf – binder only
Note: Use with Product Form code BD

Heading: Loose leaf – sheets only
Note: Use with Product Form code BD

Heading: Sewn
Note: AKA stitched; for ‘saddle-sewn’, see code B310

Heading: Unsewn / adhesive bound
Note: Including ‘perfect bound’, ‘glued’

Heading: Library binding
Note: Strengthened cloth-over-boards binding intended for libraries: use with Product form code BB

Heading: Reinforced binding
Note: Strengthened binding, not specifically intended for libraries: use with Product form code BB or BC

Heading: Half bound
Note: Highest qualiy material used on spine and corners only. Must be accompanied by a code specifiying a material, eg ‘half-bound real leather’

Heading: Quarter bound
Note: Highest qualiy material used on spine only. Must be accompanied by a code specifiying a material, eg ‘quarter bound real leather’

Heading: Saddle-sewn
Note: AKA ‘saddle-stitched’ or ‘wire-stitched’

Heading: Comb bound
Note: Round or oval plastic forms in a clamp-like configuration: use with Product Form code BE

Heading: Wire-O
Note: Twin loop metal wire spine: use with Product Form code BE

Heading: Concealed wire
Note: Cased over Coiled or Wire-O binding: use with Product Form code BE and Product Form Detail code B312 or B314

Heading: Coiled wire bound
Note: Spiral wire bound. Use with product form code BE. The default if a spiral binding type is not stated. Cf. Comb and Wire-O binding

Heading: Trade binding
Note: Hardcover binding intended for general consumers rather than libraries, use with Product form code BB. The default if a hardcover binding detail is not stated. cf. Library binding

Heading: Swiss binding
Note: Cover is attached to the book block along only one edge of the spine, allowing the cover to lay flat

Heading: Notched binding
Note: Refinement of perfect binding, with notches cut in the spine of the book block prior to glueing, to improve adhesion and durability

Heading: Self-covered
Note: Covers do not use a distinctive stock, but are the same as the body pages

Heading: Cloth over boards
Note: Cotton, linen or other woven fabric over boards. Use with <ProductForm> BB

Heading: Paper over boards
Note: Cellulose-based or similar non-woven material, which may be printed and may be embossed with an artificial cloth or leather-like texture, over boards. Use with <ProductForm> BB

Heading: Leather, real
Note: Covered with leather created by tanning animal hide. May be ‘full-grain’ using the entire thickness of the hide, ‘top grain’ using the outer layer of the hide, or ‘split’ using the inner layers of the hide. Split leather may be embossed with an artificial grain or texture. Use with <ProductForm> BG, and if appropriate with codes B308 or B309 (otherwise ‘full-bound’ is implied)

Heading: Leather, imitation
Note: Covered with synthetic leather-like material – polymer or non-animal fibre over a textile backing, usually coated and embossed with an artificial grain or texture. Leatherette, pleather etc. Use with <ProductForm> BB (or BG if particularly high-quality), and if appropriate with codes B308 or B309 (otherwise ‘full-bound’ is implied)

Heading: Leather, bonded
Note: Covered with leather reconstituted from a pulp made from shredded animal hide, layered on a fibre or textile backing, coated and usually embossed with an artificial grain or texture. Use with <ProductForm> BG, and if appropriate with codes B308 or B309 (otherwise ‘full-bound’ is implied)

Heading: Vellum
Note: Pages made with prepared but untanned animal skin (usually calf, occasionally goat or sheep). Includes parchment, a thicker and less refined form of animal skin, but not ‘paper vellum’ or vegetable parchment made from synthetic or plant fibres

Heading: Cloth
Note: Cloth, not necessarily over boards – cf B401

Heading: Imitation cloth
Note: Spanish ‘simil-tela’

Heading: Flexible plastic/vinyl cover
Note: AKA ‘flexibound’: use with Product Form code BC

Heading: Laminated cover
Note: Book, laminating material unspecified: use L101 for ‘whole product laminated’, eg a laminated sheet map or wallchart

Heading: Card cover
Note: With card cover (like a typical paperback). As distinct from a self-cover or more elaborate binding

Heading: Duplex-printed cover
Note: Printed both inside and outside the front and/or back cover

Heading: With dust jacket
Note: Type unspecified

Heading: With printed dust jacket
Note: Used to distinguish from B503

Heading: With translucent dust cover
Note: With translucent paper or plastic protective cover

Heading: With flaps
Note: For paperback with flaps

Heading: With ribbon marker(s)
Note: If the number of markers is significant, it can be stated as free text in <ProductFormDescription>

Heading: With leather edge lining
Note: AKA yapp edge?

Heading: Rough front
Note: With edge trimming such that the front edge is ragged, not neatly and squarely trimmed: AKA deckle edge, feather edge, uncut edge, rough cut

Heading: Foldout
Note: With one or more gatefold or foldout sections bound in

Heading: Wide margin
Note: Pages include extra-wide margin specifically intended for hand-written annotations

Heading: With fastening strap
Note: Book with attached loop for fixing to baby stroller, cot, chair etc

Heading: With perforated pages
Note: With one or more pages perforated and intended to be torn out for use

Heading: Acid-free paper
Note: Printed on acid-free or alkaline buffered paper conforming with ISO 9706

Heading: Archival paper
Note: Printed on acid-free or alkaline buffered paper with a high cotton content, conforming with ISO 11108

Heading: With elasticated strap
Note: Strap acts as closure or as page marker

Heading: With serialized authenticity token
Note: For example, holographic sticker such as the banderol used in the Turkish book trade

Heading: With dust jacket poster
Note: Jacket in the form of a pamphlet or poster, specifically intended to be removed and read or used separately from the book

Heading: Turn-around book
Note: A book in which half the content is printed upside-down, to be read the other way round. Also known as a ‘flip-book’ or ‘tête-bêche’ (Fr) binding, it has two front covers and a single spine. Usually an omnibus of two works

Heading: Unflipped manga format
Note: Manga with pages and panels in the sequence of the original Japanese, but with Western text

Heading: Back-to-back book
Note: A book in which half the content is printed so as to be read from the other cover. All content is printed the same way up. Also known as ‘dos-à-dos’ (Fr) binding, it has two front covers and two spines. Usually an omnibus of two works

Heading: Syllabification
Note: Text shows syllable breaks

Heading: UK Uncontracted Braille
Note: Single letters only. Was formerly identified as UK Braille Grade 1

Heading: UK Contracted Braille
Note: With some letter combinations. Was formerly identified as UK Braille Grade 2

Heading: US Braille
Note: For US Braille, prefer codes B704 and B705 as appropriate

Heading: Unified English Braille
Note: For UEB, prefer codes B708 and B709 as appropriate

Heading: Moon
Note: Moon embossed alphabet, used by some print-impaired readers who have difficulties with Braille

Heading: Real Video format
Note: Proprietary RealNetworks format. Includes Real Video packaged within a .rm RealMedia container

Heading: MS-DOS
Note: Use with an applicable Product Form code D*; note that more detail of operating system requirements can be given in a Product Form Feature composite

Heading: Windows
Note: Use with an applicable Product Form code D*; see note on D201

Heading: Macintosh
Note: Use with an applicable Product Form code D*; see note on D201

Heading: UNIX / LINUX
Note: Use with an applicable Product Form code D*; see note on D201

Heading: Other operating system(s)
Note: Use with an applicable Product Form code D*; see note on D201

Heading: Palm OS
Note: Use with an applicable Product Form code D*; see note on D201

Heading: Windows Mobile
Note: Use with an applicable Product Form code D*; see note on D201

Heading: Microsoft XBox
Note: Use with Product Form code DE or DB as applicable

Heading: Nintendo Gameboy Color
Note: Use with Product Form code DE or DB as applicable

Heading: Nintendo Gameboy Advanced
Note: Use with Product Form code DE or DB as applicable

Heading: Nintendo Gameboy
Note: Use with Product Form code DE or DB as applicable

Heading: Nintendo Gamecube
Note: Use with Product Form code DE or DB as applicable

Heading: Nintendo 64
Note: Use with Product Form code DE or DB as applicable

Heading: Sega Dreamcast
Note: Use with Product Form code DE or DB as applicable

Heading: Sega Genesis/Megadrive
Note: Use with Product Form code DE or DB as applicable

Heading: Sega Saturn
Note: Use with Product Form code DE or DB as applicable

Heading: Sony PlayStation 1
Note: Use with Product Form code DE or DB as applicable

Heading: Sony PlayStation 2
Note: Use with Product Form code DE or DB as applicable

Heading: Nintendo Dual Screen
Note: Use with Product Form code DE or DB as applicable

Heading: Sony PlayStation 3
Note: Use with Product Form code DE or DB as applicable

Heading: Xbox 360
Note: Use with Product Form code DE or DB as applicable

Heading: Nintendo Wii
Note: Use with Product Form code DE or DB as applicable

Heading: Sony PlayStation Portable (PSP)
Note: Use with Product Form code DE or DB as applicable

Heading: Sony PlayStation 3
Note: Use with Product Form code DE or DB as applicable

Heading: Sony PlayStation 4
Note: Use with Product Form code DE or DB as applicable

Heading: Sony PlayStation Vita
Note: Use with Product Form code DE or DB as applicable

Heading: Microsoft Xbox One
Note: Use with Product Form code DE or DB as applicable

Heading: Nintendo Switch
Note: Use with Product Form code DE or DB as applicable

Heading: Ninetndo Wii U
Note: Use with Product Form code DE or DB as applicable

Heading: Other
Note: No code allocated for this e-publication format yet

Heading: EPUB
Note: The Open Publication Structure / OPS Container Format standard of the International Digital Publishing Forum (IDPF) [File extension .epub]

Heading: OEB
Note: The Open EBook format of the IDPF, a predecessor of the full EPUB format, still (2008) supported as part of the latter [File extension .opf]. Includes EPUB format up to and including version 2 – but prefer code E101 for EPUB 2, and always use code E101 for EPUB 3

Heading: DOC
Note: Microsoft Word binary document format [File extension .doc]

Heading: DOCX
Note: Office Open XML / Microsoft Word XML document format (ISO/IEC 29500:2008) [File extension .docx]

Heading: HTML
Note: HyperText Mark-up Language [File extension .html, .htm]

Heading: ODF
Note: Open Document Format [File extension .odt]

Heading: PDF
Note: Portable Document Format (ISO 32000-1:2008) [File extension .pdf]

Heading: PDF/A
Note: PDF archiving format defined by ISO 19005-1:2005 [File extension .pdf]

Heading: RTF
Note: Rich Text Format [File extension .rtf]

Heading: SGML
Note: Standard Generalized Mark-up Language

Heading: TCR
Note: A compressed text format mainly used on Psion handheld devices [File extension .tcr]

Heading: TXT
Note: Text file format [File extension .txt]. Typically ASCII or Unicode UTF-8/16

Heading: XHTML
Note: Extensible Hypertext Markup Language [File extension .xhtml, .xht, .xml, .html, .htm]

Heading: zTXT
Note: A compressed text format mainly used on Palm handheld devices [File extension .pdb – see also E121, E125, E130]

Heading: XPS
Note: XML Paper Specification format [File extension .xps]

Heading: Amazon Kindle
Note: A format proprietary to Amazon for use with its Kindle reading devices or software readers [File extensions .azw, .mobi, .prc etc]. Prefer code E148 for Print Replica files

Heading: BBeB
Note: A Sony proprietary format for use with the Sony Reader and LIBRIé reading devices [File extension .lrf]

Heading: DXReader
Note: A proprietary format for use with DXReader software

Heading: EBL
Note: A format proprietary to the Ebook Library service

Heading: Ebrary
Note: A format proprietary to the Ebrary service

Heading: eReader
Note: A proprietary format for use with eReader (AKA ‘Palm Reader’) software on various hardware platforms [File extension .pdb – see also E114, E125, E130]

Heading: Exebook
Note: A proprietary format with its own reading system for Windows platforms [File extension .exe]

Heading: Franklin eBookman
Note: A proprietary format for use with the Franklin eBookman reader

Heading: Gemstar Rocketbook
Note: A proprietary format for use with the Gemstar Rocketbook reader [File extension .rb]

Heading: iSilo
Note: A proprietary format for use with iSilo software on various hardware platforms [File extension .pdb – see also E114, E121, E130]

Heading: Microsoft Reader
Note: A proprietary format for use with Microsoft Reader software on Windows and Pocket PC platforms [File extension .lit]

Heading: Mobipocket
Note: A proprietary format for use with Mobipocket software on various hardware platforms [File extensions .mobi, .prc]. Includes Amazon Kindle formats up to and including version 7 – but prefer code E116 for version 7, and always use E116 for KF8

Heading: MyiLibrary
Note: A format proprietary to the MyiLibrary service

Heading: NetLibrary
Note: A format proprietary to the NetLibrary service

Heading: Plucker
Note: A proprietary format for use with Plucker reader software on Palm and other handheld devices [File extension .pdb – see also E114, E121, E125]

Heading: VitalBook
Note: A format proprietary to the VitalSource service

Heading: Vook
Note: A proprietary digital product combining text and video content and available to be used online or as a downloadable application for a mobile device – see www.vook.com

Heading: Google Edition
Note: An epublication made available by Google in association with a publisher; readable online on a browser-enabled device and offline on designated ebook readers

Heading: Book ‘app’ for iOS
Note: Epublication packaged as application for iOS (eg Apple iPhone, iPad etc), containing both executable code and content. Use <ProductContentType> to describe content, and <ProductFormFeatureType> to list detailed technical requirements

Heading: Book ‘app’ for Android
Note: Epublication packaged as application for Android (eg Android phone or tablet), containing both executable code and content. Use <ProductContentType> to describe content, and <ProductFormFeatureType> to list detailed technical requirements

Heading: Book ‘app’ for other operating system
Note: Epublication packaged as application, containing both executable code and content. Use where other ‘app’ codes are not applicable. Technical requirements such as target operating system and/or device should be provided eg in <ProductFormFeatureType>. Content type (text or text plus various ‘enhancements’) may be described with <ProductContentType>

Heading: CEB
Note: Founder Apabi’s proprietary basic e-book format

Heading: CEBX
Note: Founder Apabi’s proprietary XML e-book format

Heading: iBook
Note: Apple’s iBook format (a proprietary extension of EPUB), can only be read on Apple iOS devices

Heading: ePIB
Note: Proprietary format based on EPUB used by Barnes and Noble for fixed-format e-books, readable on NOOK devices and Nook reader software

Heading: SCORM
Note: Sharable Content Object Reference Model, standard content and packaging format for e-learning objects

Heading: EBP
Note: E-book Plus (proprietary Norwegian e-book format)

Heading: Page Perfect
Note: Proprietary format based on PDF used by Barnes and Noble for fixed-format e-books, readable on some NOOK devices and Nook reader software

Heading: BRF
Note: Electronic Braille file

Heading: Erudit
Note: Proprietary XML format for articles, see for example https://www.cairn.info/services-aux-editeurs.php

Heading: Amazon Kindle Print Replica
Note: A format proprietary to Amazon for use with its Kindle reading devices or software readers. Essentially a PDF embedded within a KF8 format file

Heading: Reflowable
Note: Use this and/or code E201 when a particular e-publication type (specified using codes E100 and upwards) has both fixed format and reflowable variants, to indicate which option is included in this product

Heading: Fixed format
Note: Use this and/or code E200 when a particular e-publication type (specified using codes E100 and upwards) has both fixed format and reflowable variants, to indicate which option is included in this product

Heading: Readable offline
Note: All e-publication resources are included within the e-publication package

Heading: Requires network connection
Note: E-publication requires a network connection to access some resources (eg an enhanced e-book where video clips are not stored within the e-publication package itself, but are delivered via an internet connection)

Heading: Content removed
Note: Resources (eg images) present in other editions have been removed from this product, eg due to rights issues

Heading: Landscape
Note: Use for fixed-format e-books optimised for landscape display. Also include an indication of the optimal screen aspect ratio

Heading: Portrait
Note: Use for fixed-format e-books optimised for portrait display. Also include an indication of the optimal screen aspect ratio

Use for fixed-format e-books optimised for displays with a 5:4 aspect ratio (eg 1280x1024 pixels etc, assuming square pixels). Note that aspect ratio codes are NOT specific to actual screen dimensions or pixel counts, but to the ratios between two dimensions or two pixel counts
Use for fixed-format e-books optimised for displays with a 4:3 aspect ratio (eg 800x600, 1024x768, 2048x1536 pixels etc)
Use for fixed-format e-books optimised for displays with a 3:2 aspect ratio (eg 960x640, 3072x2048 pixels etc)
Use for fixed-format e-books optimised for displays with a 16:10 aspect ratio (eg 1440x900, 2560x1600 pixels etc)
Use for fixed-format e-books optimised for displays with a 16:9 aspect ratio (eg 1024x576, 1920x1080, 2048x1152 pixels etc)

Heading: Laminated
Note: Whole product laminated (eg laminated map, fold-out chart, wallchart, etc): use B415 for book with laminated cover

Heading: Desk calendar
Note: Use with Product Form code PC

Heading: Mini calendar
Note: Use with Product Form code PC

Heading: Engagement calendar
Note: Use with Product Form code PC

Heading: Day by day calendar
Note: Use with Product Form code PC

Heading: Poster calendar
Note: Use with Product Form code PC

Heading: Wall calendar
Note: Use with Product Form code PC

Heading: Perpetual calendar
Note: Use with Product Form code PC

Heading: Advent calendar
Note: Use with Product Form code PC

Heading: Bookmark calendar
Note: Use with Product Form code PC

Heading: Student calendar
Note: Use with Product Form code PC

Heading: Project calendar
Note: Use with Product Form code PC

Heading: Almanac calendar
Note: Use with Product Form code PC

Heading: Other calendar
Note: A calendar that is not one of the types specified elsewhere: use with Product Form code PC

Heading: Other calendar or organiser product
Note: A product that is associated with or ancillary to a calendar or organiser, eg a deskstand for a calendar, or an insert for an organiser: use with Product Form code PC or PS

Heading: Picture story cards
Note: Kamishibai / Cantastoria cards

Heading: Hardback (stationery)
Note: Stationery item in hardback book format

Heading: Paperback / softback (stationery)
Note: Stationery item in paperback/softback book format

Heading: Spiral bound (stationery)
Note: Stationery item in spiral-bound book format

Heading: Leather / fine binding (stationery)
Note: Stationery item in leather-bound book format, or other fine binding

Heading: With hanging strips
Note: For wall map, poster, wallchart etc

Heading: PAL
Note: SD TV standard for video or DVD

Heading: NTSC
Note: SD TV standard for video or DVD

Heading: SECAM
Note: SD TV standard for video or DVD

Heading: HD
Note: Up to 2K resolution (1920 or 2048 pixels wide) eg for Blu-Ray

Heading: UHD
Note: Up to 4K resolution (3840 or 4096 pixels wide) eg for Ultra HD Blu-Ray

Heading: 3D video
Note: Eg for Blu-ray 3D

Heading: Home use
Note: Licensed for use in domestic contexts only

Heading: Classroom use
Note: Licensed for use in education
